title: Doppler - rank frequency for observers X Y Z

content.question: A sound source that emits sound of a fixed frequency is moving to the left at a constant speed, as shown in the figure. Three observers, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, are positioned as indicated. Observer <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is being approached by the sound source, Observer <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is moving with the source, and Observer <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> has the source moving away from them. Which of the following correctly compares the sound frequencies <math alttext="f sub x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="f sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="f sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> as heard by observers <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="f sub X is greater than, f sub Y, which is greater than f sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, f sub X, equals f sub Z, close parenthesis, which is greater than f sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="f sub Y, is greater than, open parenthesis, f sub X equals f sub Z, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f sub Z is greater than f sub Y, which is greater than f sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f sub X is greater than, f sub Y, which is greater than f sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
